instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> totally dead
threads.message:
I have got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which is totally dead. 

I only have 0.3V on PPDCIN. All rails dead. 

Where should I look first (beside the DC-in fuse which is OK)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> totally dead
threads.message: Short on DCIN bus? Use a fake chinese charger for trouble shooting, it won't shut down.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> totally dead
threads.message:
Thanks Duke. 

It was <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> shorted to GND

Please mark solved
